summary: This document is a series of forwarded emails from Christopher Dilorio to the SEC, alleging a complex financial fraud and money laundering scheme involving Environmental Solutions Worldwide, Inc. (ESWW), and connecting it to Jeffrey Epstein, Apollo Global Management (Leon Black, Joshua Harris, Marc Rowan), Jared Kushner, and SEC officials. The author claims the SEC is corruptly obstructing investigation and that ESWW was a shell used for money laundering, with ties to Epstein and Apollo.

persons.name: Christopher Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the emails, making allegations of financial fraud, money laundering, and SEC corruption involving ESWW, Epstein, Apollo, and Kushner. Identifies himself as a whistleblower.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as a 'degenerate' and alleged to be running an 'extortion/Ponzi/Slush Fund'. Claimed to be connected to the ESWW shell company via a filing by his Financial Trust Company Inc. alongside Leon Black/Apollo.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Described as a 'Milken protege' and 'degenerate'. Allegedly involved with the ESWW shell company through filings by his family trust and Apollo. Implied to have connections to Epstein and Kushner.

persons.name: Jared Kushner
persons.context: Allegedly connected to Apollo; the SEC dropped an investigation into Apollo a month after Apollo loaned Kushner Companies $180 million. Kushner reportedly met with Apollo's Joshua Harris at the White House.

persons.name: Joshua Harris
persons.context: Another 'Milken protege' and Apollo founding partner. Allegedly considered for a White House job and met with Jared Kushner at the White House prior to the SEC dropping an investigation into Apollo.

persons.name: Marc Rowan
persons.context: Named as a 'Milken protege' and part of Apollo, which allegedly knows ESWW was a money laundering shell.

persons.name: Stephanie Avakian
persons.context: Named in an email alleging 'home cooking' and corruption, implying her connection to law firms (O'Melveny, WilmerHale) that represent Apollo influenced the SEC's dropped investigation.

persons.name: Howard E. Heiss
persons.context: Linked in the email chain as a lawyer with a practice focused on government regulatory investigations, implying a connection to the Apollo/Kushner matter.

persons.name: Jamie Gorelick
persons.context: Named as a well-known Washington litigator at WilmerHale, a firm also linked to former FBI Director Robert Mueller, in the context of alleged connections to the Apollo matter.

persons.name: Robert Mueller III
persons.role: Former FBI Director, Partner at WilmerHale
persons.context: Mentioned as having joined WilmerHale, a firm implicated in the email's narrative of legal connections surrounding Apollo and the SEC.

persons.name: Carl Kline
persons.context: Mentioned in a linked news article about a White House whistleblower speaking out on security clearance controversies, which the email author connects to the Kushner narrative.

persons.name: Mark Yung
persons.role: Co-Founder, OCV Management LLC / Board Member, ESW Group
persons.context: Listed on the 'Our Board' page of ESW Group's website, the successor to Environmental Solutions Worldwide, Inc.

connections.description: Alleged connection through the Environmental Solutions Worldwide (ESWW) shell company, where Epstein's Financial Trust Company Inc. and Black's Apollo/family trust both filed with the SEC regarding ESWW.

connections.person1: Apollo Global Management (via Leon Black/Joshua Harris)
connections.description: Alleged quid pro quo: Apollo gave Kushner Companies a $180 million loan, and subsequently, the SEC dropped an investigation into Apollo. Kushner also met with Apollo's Joshua Harris at the White House.
Dilorio is a whistleblower making repeated, aggressive allegations of corruption and obstruction against the SEC, challenging them to refute his claims.
Email implies a network of 'home cooking' where SEC officials have professional ties to law firms that represent clients like Apollo, suggesting potential conflict of interest.

keyFacts: The author, Christopher Dilorio, alleges Environmental Solutions Worldwide, Inc. (ESWW) was a NASDAQ/OTC shell company used for money laundering, known to the SEC, Epstein, and Apollo.
Dilorio claims a direct link between Jeffrey Epstein and the ESWW shell, citing an SEC filing by Epstein's Financial Trust Company Inc. alongside filings by Leon Black and Apollo.

The email chain alleges a corrupt quid pro quo: the SEC dropped an investigation into Apollo shortly after Apollo loaned $180 million to Jared Kushner's family business and after Kushner met with Apollo's Joshua Harris at the White House.
Dilorio accuses the SEC of intentional obstruction and corruption, claiming the agency protects fraudulent penny stock shells to facilitate abusive naked shorting and money laundering.
